content: On https://events.backdropcms.org/faq, the three links under "Do all discussions..." at the bottom of the page lead to 404s.

As folks can tell, the website has not been getting the attention it needs and deserves. Some of the content was cut and pasted from the last event with the intention of editing it later. Unfortunately, not all the pages were edited as hoped.

I'll look at these issues.
@ericfg - I am not sure if we properly tested the email confirmation process. I'll take a look. You are registered.
@bugfolder - you are also registered.

Of course, totally understand, and can sympathize, having put together a similar event for the main site I manage (using CiviCRM for event registrations, User Time Zone Tokens to make all dates and times in page text time-zone-aware). I know you're in the thick of things right now, but I'd be happy to share implementation details when it's convenient (of course there are folks like @Laryn who know WAY more about Civi than me).
Thx for registration confirmation.

I will probably schedule a session on "event websites" during Backdrop LIVE. But, I've already nominated and am facilitating several topics - so I will wait.

If anyone else wants to put that topic on the schedule and facilitate, I'll try to be there.
Probably premature for me to try to put something together this time around for BDLive, but next year our site will be on Backdrop, so it may be appropriate by then.

The point of Backdrop LIVE is that you don't really need to prepare a presentation. Many of these sessions will be informal discussions and we just need someone to facilitate them. Maybe have something ready to share/demo (but that is not required).
Understood, but I'd want to use the Backdrop version to demo, and it's not ready yet (other pieces still need porting/adapting).
The link I gave was still on D7. Backdrop port is ongoing.

I understand and I'm not going to pressure you. But, I am confident that there are several people in the community that are interested in this topic and if ONE person puts it on the schedule, others will show up and share what they have.

I am fully prepared to talk about the few things that we did properly implement on the events.backdropcms.org site and goals for the future, if someone schedules the topic. ;-)

But, it doesn't have to be you.
Of course my participation is contingent on when it is scheduled and what else is happening at the time.

Understood. But I'd really like to see what one of these things is like before diving in as a facilitator/organizer of a session for something I've never attended before (and I'm still pretty new to this community, and still finding myself over the tips of my skis regularly). Maybe in July, though.

StPaulTim said:

Of course my participation is contingent on when it is scheduled and what else is happening at the time.

I think that's true for everyone :wink:

FYI, here's the issue queue for the events site: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org/issues

backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org
Backdrop LIVE events. Contribute to backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org development by creating an account on GitHub.
How much info can be added to the Zulip stream description? We could put links to the site and issue queue there if it fits.

@Laryn Good thought.

How much info can be added to the Zulip stream description? We could put links to the site and issue queue there if it fits.

I didn't test the length limits, but I was able to include the events site and issue queue URL is the description for this stream.
@StPaulTim I've created an account on the events site but didn't get a confirmation mail. Should I file an issue in the queue?

From the FAQ:

Details will be emailed to registered attendees on Wednesday or Thursday, Mar 12-13 and posted on the website.

I think that should be Mar 10-11?

A couple of people have reported that. I've just opened a stub issue for that.
https://github.com/backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org/issues/13

Confirmation email after registration 路 Issue #13 路 backdrop-ops/events.backdropcms.org
Several users have reported that they did not get confirmation emails after registering.
I will fix that FAQ now. Does anyone want edit access to the Events site?
I just gave a few people admin access to the site.
I see I have admin access now! Tried to see if I could help with the no registration emails issue but the settings look right to me.

Thanks for checking that out @jackaponte. I have not had time to look at it.

I created nodes for all of the currently scheduled sessions. I think we need a place where hosts can add more information and/or link to resources/presentations.

Here is a view. It's all still a but chaotic, so I have not created any public links to this page. (yet).

If anyone wants to work on this. Feel free to help improve or configure the schedule on the live site.
https://events.backdropcms.org/schedule
Ideally, I think that all hosts should be able to edit their nodes and add information Obviously, we dont' have much time left.

If hosts have accounts on the site, we can make them the author of their node to give them edit access.

If anyone needs help gaining access to edit your discussion topic, let us know. Several folks have admin access to this site and can help you.

Several folks have admin access to this site and can help you.

If anyone could help me to log in, that would be great. I've created an account for the site but didn't get an email about it, so I can't log in (and consequently can't register for the event).
I've already used the password reset but didn't receive that email either.
Everything okay now, I was able to log in. Thanks @StPaulTim and @Laryn !

@jenlampton and anyone else. Here is a draft "welcome" email.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fbe8T9_1VkpcKra2joQ8FlWi5jnM8TjVqAHcjqk9yAs/edit

Untitled document
=================================================================== Dear Backdrop Friends, Backdrop LIVE is starting in about 10 hours and we are so excited to see you there. Here are the most important things for you to know. Over the 24+ hours of Backdrop LIVE, we will be directly interac...
I'll wait about 30 minutes for feedback on this email before sending it.
@jenlampton - any updates on what you are doing and if I can be of assistance?
I'm going to work on providing a little content for each topic right now. But, I want to be careful to avoid stepping on toes regarding the site, since you seem to be working on it as well
Email looks good
Wow, that schedule is suddenly looking much nicer. Thanks.
How are we handling time listings?

@docwilmot - I put some quick text in your topic for tomorrow. Please, feel free to edit this node.
https://events.backdropcms.org/sessions/building-a-forum-with-backdrop-cms
I think you should have access.
OK, thx
@StPaulTim rendered term showing now on sessions: https://events.backdropcms.org/sessions/building-a-forum-with-backdrop-cms (for times in different timezones)
Very nice!
it looks great!!!
I'm excited :)

I understand that it's a result of migrating over from the spreadsheet (where there were blocked-out times between session groups), but the slot numbers look very random. I can only imagine how confusing they might be to someone looking at this for the first time (without having seen any previous incarnations of the schedule)...
Just checked out https://events.backdropcms.org/schedule and I strongly agree with @BWPanda here, the "Slot #" stuff is just confusing now.
@StPaulTim if I can figure out how to remove those Slot #s, would you be okay with that? Or should I find something more important to help with? hehe
No, I think that would be fine.
@jackaponte Actually, i think that would be great.
Cool, I'll work on that now!
@StPaulTim and anyone else here who wants to input:
I realize that will take changing all the term names in the Time Slot vocabulary, https://events.backdropcms.org/admin/structure/taxonomy/time_slot

I'd be renaming "Block B - Slot 6" to "Block B - Slot 4" since it follows slot 3 in the schedule; what's currently Slot 13 would wind up being Slot 8. So all the existing slot numbers will change by varying degrees for all sessions after Slot 3.

Will that be too confusing? Unfortunately there's no way around having _some_ ordering system, just a question of whether it a) skips numbers weirdly but does not change midway through the event, or b) doesn't skip numbers weirdly but changes midway during the event and possibly confuses people?
I'm not sure how likely b) is
@jackaponte I don't see how it would need to change during the event. We're not going to be adding new slots, right...? I'd say just go for it!
@BWPanda the change i mean is the change we'd be making: folks might have advertised "I'm facilitating this discussion in Slot 13" and now it's in Slot 8
but that's probably unlikely. :) I'll try to make that change soon, once I'm not in this convo on funding Backdrop! :)

@StPaulTim I can't look into this more now, but there's something wrong with the schedule I think... Block A-2 says 7am Oakland and 1am Sydney. But then Block E-26 says 7am Oakland and 2am Sydney. I'm pretty sure time doesn't run differently between the two places... :wink:
It might when daylight savings time is changing. :smile:
Sure, but that's not today.
I see, you're already moving on to the next event, but wanted to mention, that it might make sense to hide the registration links for now on events.backdropcms.org :wink:
And remove the "Backdrop LIVE is coming March 12/13" banner on b.org too!

I did a quick pass to remove Registration links and the Backdrop LIVE message on b.org. Let me know if you see anything urgent that needs changing. We'll try to clean up events.backdropcms.org soon to focus on upcoming events, while archive info about the last Backdrop LIVE.

But, today is not that day. :-)
Also, removing the BackdropCMS.org message from dashboard.
